title: External package dependency resolution issue when building Trilinos
body:
I am attempting to build Trilinos, but spack ignores my external package entry for MKL.

packages.yaml
```
packages:
  mkl:
    compiler: [intel@16.0.3]
    paths:
      mkl@11.3.3.210%intel@16.0.3 arch=linux-rhel7-x86_64: /usr/projects/hpcsoft/toss3/common/intel-clusterstudio/2016.3.067/compilers_and_libraries_2016.3.210/linux/mkl
    buildable: False
  openmpi:
    version: [1.10.3]
    paths:
      openmpi@1.10.3%intel@16.0.3 arch=linux-rhel7-x86_64: /usr/projects/hpcsoft/toss3/snow/openmpi/1.10.3-intel-16.0.3
    buildable: False
  all:
    compiler: [intel@16.0.3]
    providers:
      mpi: [openmpi@1.10.3]
      blas: [mkl@11.3.3.210]
      lapack: [mkl@11.3.3.210]
```

```
$  spack spec trilinos@12.8.1~boost~hypre~mumps~suite-sparse+superlu-dist ^superlu-dist@4.3
Input spec
--------------------------------
trilinos@12.8.1~boost~hypre~mumps~suite-sparse+superlu-dist

Normalized
--------------------------------

    ^blas
    ^cmake@2.8:
    ^glm
    ^lapack
    ^matio
    ^mpi
    ^netcdf+mpi
        ^curl@7.18.0:
            ^openssl
                ^zlib@1.2.5:
        ^hdf5
        ^m4
    ^superlu-dist@4.3
        ^metis@5:
        ^parmetis

Concretized
--------------------------------

    ^cmake@3.6.2%intel@16.0.3~doc+ncurses+openssl+ownlibs~qt arch=linux-rhel7-x86_64
    ^glm@0.9.7.1%intel@16.0.3 arch=linux-rhel7-x86_64
    ^hdf5@1.10.0-patch1%intel@16.0.3+cxx~debug+fortran+mpi+shared~szip~threadsafe arch=linux-rhel7-x86_64
        ^openmpi@1.10.3%intel@16.0.3~mxm~pmi~psm~psm2~slurm~sqlite3~thread_multiple~tm+verbs+vt arch=linux-rhel7-x86_64
        ^zlib@1.2.8%intel@16.0.3 arch=linux-rhel7-x86_64
    ^matio@1.5.9%intel@16.0.3+hdf5+zlib arch=linux-rhel7-x86_64
    ^metis@5.1.0%intel@16.0.3~debug~gdb~idx64~real64+shared arch=linux-rhel7-x86_64
    ^mkl@11.3.3.210%intel@16.0.3~ilp64~openmp+shared arch=linux-rhel7-x86_64
    ^netcdf@4.4.1%intel@16.0.3~hdf4 maxdims=1024 maxvars=8192+mpi arch=linux-rhel7-x86_64
        ^curl@7.50.3%intel@16.0.3 arch=linux-rhel7-x86_64
            ^openssl@1.0.2j%intel@16.0.3 arch=linux-rhel7-x86_64

            ^libsigsegv@2.10%intel@16.0.3 arch=linux-rhel7-x86_64

    ^superlu-dist@4.3%intel@16.0.3 arch=linux-rhel7-x86_64

$ spack install trilinos@12.8.1~boost~hypre~mumps~suite-sparse+superlu-dist ^superlu-dist@4.3

curl: (37) Couldn't open file /yellow/usr/projects/draco/vendors/spack.sn.20161114/l_mkl_11.3.3.210.tgz
==> Fetching from file:///yellow/usr/projects/draco/vendors/spack.sn.20161114/l_mkl_11.3.3.210.tgz failed.
==> Error: FetchError: All fetchers failed for mkl-11.3.3.210-vkuwqosedpftgbos5ehuvy6qr3cuoyzf
```

I don't understand why spack is trying to install MKL.  Additionally, if I remove the dependency on superlu-dist, spack will use the external-package definition MKL.

```
$ spack spec trilinos@12.8.1~boost~hypre~mumps~suite-sparse~superlu-dist
Input spec

    ^netcdf+mpi
        ^curl@7.18.0:
            ^openssl
                ^zlib@1.2.5:
        ^hdf5
        ^m4

Concretized
--------------------------------
trilinos@12.8.1%intel@16.0.3~boost~debug+hdf5~hypre+metis~mumps~python+shared~suite-sparse~superlu-dist arch=linux-rhel7-x86_64
    ^cmake@3.6.2%intel@16.0.3~doc+ncurses+openssl+ownlibs~qt arch=linux-rhel7-x86_64
    ^glm@0.9.7.1%intel@16.0.3 arch=linux-rhel7-x86_64
    ^hdf5@1.10.0-patch1%intel@16.0.3+cxx~debug+fortran+mpi+shared~szip~threadsafe arch=linux-rhel7-x86_64
        ^openmpi@1.10.3%intel@16.0.3~mxm~pmi~psm~psm2~slurm~sqlite3~thread_multiple~tm+verbs+vt arch=linux-rhel7-x86_64
        ^zlib@1.2.8%intel@16.0.3 arch=linux-rhel7-x86_64
    ^matio@1.5.9%intel@16.0.3+hdf5+zlib arch=linux-rhel7-x86_64
    ^metis@5.1.0%intel@16.0.3~debug~gdb~idx64~real64+shared arch=linux-rhel7-x86_64
    ^mkl@11.3.3.210%intel@16.0.3~ilp64~openmp+shared arch=linux-rhel7-x86_64
    ^netcdf@4.4.1%intel@16.0.3~hdf4 maxdims=1024 maxvars=8192+mpi arch=linux-rhel7-x86_64
        ^curl@7.50.3%intel@16.0.3 arch=linux-rhel7-x86_64
            ^openssl@1.0.2j%intel@16.0.3 arch=linux-rhel7-x86_64
        ^m4@1.4.17%intel@16.0.3+sigsegv arch=linux-rhel7-x86_64
            ^libsigsegv@2.10%intel@16.0.3 arch=linux-rhel7-x86_64
    ^parmetis@4.0.3%intel@16.0.3~debug~gdb+shared arch=linux-rhel7-x86_64

$ spack install trilinos@12.8.1~boost~hypre~mumps~suite-sparse~superlu-dist ==> success!
```

Any ideas on how to convince spack to use the external-package definition of MKL in the first case above?
